page.title: 06Knightshayes-NE.of Tiverton
page.content: Knightshayes Court is owned by the National Trust. The estate covers an area of 240 acres,twentyfive acres of which are gardens.The house was built in 1870 by William Burgess and it is a very fine Victorian mansion. The forests around Knightshayes are used for timber and the gardens and terraces are very beautiful with rare shrubs and plants. The second largest tree in England is within seeing distance of the Court. More than thirty people work at Knightshayes at peak times.The Court was built for the son of John Heathcoat who founded the Textile Factory in Tiverton. It was given to the National Trust in 1973.
